snippet: Mr. Bush used his first campaign-style speech to cast declining economic mobility as a central theme for his likely presidential run.
abstract: Former Florida Gov Jeb Bush, in addressing Detroit Economic Club, says economic recovery is leaving low- and middle-income Americans behind, in shift from traditional Republican stance on income inequality; he is narrowing his message to confront complicated challenges undermining improvement of economy, as he prepares for likely run in 2016 presidential race.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bush used his first campaign-style speech to cast declining economic mobility as a central theme for his likely presidential run.

headline.main: On Economy, Jeb Bush Tests Divergent Message
headline.print_headline: On Economy, Jeb Bush Tests Divergent Message
